item.title: 特朗普与习近平讨论贸易问题，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在美国当选总统就职典礼之前，唐纳德-特朗普与中国领导人习近平进行了积极的对话，亚洲股市周一早盘将随美国股市走高而攀升。【原文：Asian equities were set to climb in early trading on Monday, tracking US peers higher following a positive conversation between Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping ahead of the US President-elect’s inauguration.】

item.title: 在出口依赖度飙升之际，中国正面临特朗普的回归
item.description: 中国正面临着唐纳德-特朗普就任第一任总统期间的紧张局势和不确定性的重演，只是与第一次对美贸易战期间相比，中国经济更加疲软，更加依赖出口。【原文：China is facing a repeat of the tensions and uncertainty from the first presidency of Donald Trump, only with a weaker economy that’s even more reliant on exports than it was during the first trade war with the US.】

item.title: 新加坡金管局中枢成为焦点，新加坡元将走软
item.description: 在新加坡央行转向宽松和美国关税波及全球经济的预期下，新加坡货币的疲软可能会持续下去。【原文：Singapore’s currency weakness is likely to endure amid expectations that its central bank pivots to easing and US tariffs ripple through the global economy.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，美国的关税问题以及针对俄罗斯石油的行动所产生的影响都成为人们关注的焦点。与此同时，潜在的合并将创造一个矿业强国。【原文：US tariffs are on the forefront as Donald Trump returns to the White House as well as the fallout from sactions against Russian oil. Meanwhile, a potential merger would create a mining powerhouse.】

item.title: 特朗普取悦 TikTok 用户，但推迟对应用程序的禁令却面临质疑
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周日承诺推迟执行威胁要封禁 TikTok 的国家安全法，但目前尚不清楚该应用的中国母公司是否满足了必要的要求，以延长寻找可能买家的最后期限，避免永久关闭。【原文：Donald Trump pledged Sunday to delay enforcement of a national security law that threatened to ban TikTok, but it’s not clear that the app’s Chinese parent company has satisfied the requirements necessary to extend the deadline to find a possible buyer and avoid a permanent shutdown.】

item.title: CC资本在收购战中获准进入Insignia图书公司
item.description: Insignia Financial Ltd.在有限的时间内允许CC Capital Partners访问其部分账户，试图吸引这家美国公司以更高的报价收购这家澳大利亚财富管理公司。【原文：Insignia Financial Ltd. gave CC Capital Partners access to some of its accounts for a limited time as it attempts to lure the US firm into a higher offer for the Australian wealth manager.】

item.title: 特朗普与管理主导美元的艺术
item.description:
财务主管们重新审视了货币管理方面的一个老问题。此外，Aon 首席财务官还谈到了交易和洛杉矶大火等气候事件对保险业的影响。【原文：

Finance chiefs revisit an age-old question around currency management. Plus, Aon’s CFO talks about dealmaking and the impact of climate events like the LA fires on the insurance industry.

】

item.title: 特朗普就任总统前中国科技股套期保值成本降低
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普即将开始白宫的第二个任期，全球投资者都在为贸易政策的重大变化做准备。他们关注的一个行业是中国的科技行业，他们的看法是：拭目以待。【原文：With Donald Trump about to start a second term in the White House, investors around the globe are bracing for big changes in trade policies. One sector they’re zeroing in on is China tech, and the sentiment is: wait and see.】

item.title: 北京时间称，比亚迪的供应链融资掩盖了不断膨胀的债务
item.description: 根据香港 GMT Research 公司的计算，比亚迪股份有限公司对营运资金融资的依赖掩盖了这家中国电动汽车巨头不断攀升的债务水平。【原文：BYD Co.’s reliance on financing from working capital has masked surging debt levels at the Chinese electric vehicle giant, according to calculations from Hong Kong-based GMT Research.】

item.title: Instagram 在 TikTok 禁用日发布新视频编辑应用程序
item.description: 就在 Instagram 发布名为 "Edits "的新视频编辑应用的同一天，竞争对手视频服务 TikTok 也因联邦禁令而短暂关闭。【原文：Instagram announced a new video editing app, called Edits, on the same day that rival video service TikTok briefly went dark in response to a federal ban.】

item.title: 逆向赌注出现：美联储下一步行动将更高而非更低
item.description: 美联储下一步的利率行动将是上调，而不是下调。【原文：It’s at best, a longshot, but one that’s emerged among a group of die-hard bond traders — that the Federal Reserve’s next move on interest rates will be up, not down.】

item.title: 尼日利亚煤气罐爆炸死亡人数升至 86 人，55 人受伤
item.description: 尼日利亚阿布贾（美联社）— 尼日利亚紧急反应机构周日表示，尼日利亚中北部汽油罐车爆炸造成的死亡人数已上升至 86 人。【原文：ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) — The death toll from a gasoline tanker explosion in north-central Nigeria has risen to 86, the country’s emergency response agency said on Sunday.】

item.title: 弗里兰开启加拿大竞选活动，发出她能对抗特朗普的信息
item.description: 周日，克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）正式拉开了她竞选加拿大领导人的序幕，她告诉支持者，她是与美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对抗的最佳人选。【原文：Chrystia Freeland formally kicked off her campaign to lead Canada on Sunday, telling supporters that she’s the best candidate to do battle with US President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 航空业的排放惰性正在困扰新西兰的门户网站
item.description: 新西兰主要航空枢纽奥克兰机场的首席执行官表示，由于偏远地区缺乏低排放燃料，她对航空业在去碳化方面缺乏进展感到担忧。【原文：The chief executive officer of New Zealand’s main aviation hub, Auckland Airport, said she’s worried about the industry’s lack of progress toward decarbonization as remote destinations grapple with a shortage of low-emissions fuel.】

item.title: 特朗普誓言延长最后期限后，TikTok 将恢复服务
item.description: 当选总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布将延长出售公司的最后期限后，TikTok 周日表示正在恢复服务。【原文：TikTok said Sunday it’s in the process of restoring service after President-elect Donald Trump announced he would extend a deadline to sell the company.】

item.title: 爱德曼称通胀和就业恐慌加剧内乱风险
item.description: 据传播公司爱德曼（Edelman）称，全球通胀恐慌和对经济转型将侵蚀就业岗位的担忧，正在助长人们认为世界正变得越来越不公平的看法，并可能引发民间动乱作为回应。【原文：A global inflation scare and concerns that economic shifts will erode jobs is feeding perceptions that the world is becoming increasingly unfair, threatening civil unrest as a response, according to communications firm Edelman.】

item.title: 西班牙总理旨在禁止非欧盟公民购房
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）表示，他将提议禁止非欧盟公民在该国购房。【原文：Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said he will propose banning non-EU citizens from buying houses in the country.】

item.title: 穆巴达拉（Mubadala）将对土耳其盖蒂尔（Getir）进行改造，创始人誓言继续奋斗
item.description: 阿布扎比主权财富基金穆巴达拉（Mubadala）将对其去年收购控股的土耳其 Getir 杂货配送服务公司进行重组。【原文：Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund Mubadala will proceed with a restructuring of the Turkish Getir grocery delivery service which it bought a controlling stake in last year.】

item.title: 莫桑比克在投票骚乱后考虑重组公共债务
item.description: 东南非国家莫桑比克的新任财政部长表示，莫桑比克政府在大选后的动乱中损失了约 420 亿梅西卡（约合 6.58 亿美元）的收入，因此莫桑比克正在考虑重组公共债务。【原文：Mozambique is considering restructuring its public debt after the government lost about 42 billion meticais ($658 million) of revenues in post-election unrest, the southeast African nation’s new finance minister said.】

item.title: 新兴市场动态：债券销售盛宴停滞不前（播客）
item.description: 塞尔库克-戈科卢克（Selcuk Gokoluk）与宋子嘉一起讨论新兴市场债券销售因美国借贷成本上升和美联储路径不确定而停滞不前的问题。【原文：Selcuk Gokoluk joins Zijia Song to discuss a stalling emerging-market bond sale due to elevated US borrowing costs and uncertainty of Federal Reserve’s path.】

item.title: 美国优先 "阻碍了新兴市场的债券发行热潮
item.description: 今年新兴市场债券销售创下历史新高，但由于国债利率居高不下，阻碍了实力较弱的企业获得国际资本的青睐，因此新兴市场债券销售面临衰退的风险。【原文：A record start to the year for emerging-market bond sales is at risk of fizzling as high Treasury rates hamper weaker credits from tapping international capital.】

item.title: 苹果不太可能收购 Sonos，但亚马逊或 Spotify 可能会考虑收购
item.description: 扬声器制造商 Sonos 的困境引发了收购的前景，但谁会愿意收购它呢？另外：iPhone SE 库存在重大改版前缩减；苹果公司在删除新闻摘要的同时，为 Mac 准备了更多人工智能功能；苹果公司前首席人事官加盟惠普。【原文：The woes of speaker maker Sonos have raised the prospect of a takeover, but who might want to buy it? Also: iPhone SE inventory shrinks ahead of a major revamp; Apple prepares more AI for the Mac even as it removes news summaries; and the company’s former chief people officer lands at HP.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜引发市场狂热，现在才是真正的考验
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在 11 月的美国总统大选中获胜，立即引发了市场反弹，股市飞涨，美元飙升，比特币也一飞冲天。但仅仅两个月后，这位共和党人就将重返白宫，而其中只有部分交易还在继续。【原文：Donald Trump’s victory in the November US presidential election sparked an immediate rally in markets, with stocks flying, the dollar soaring and Bitcoin leaping off the charts. But just two months later, the Republican is set to return to the White House, and only some of those trades endure.】

item.title: 施纳贝尔告诉《金融时报》：欧洲央行可以降息，但需谨慎
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）告诉《金融时报》，随着通胀率向2%靠拢，欧洲中央银行可能还有继续降低借贷成本的空间，但必须谨慎行事。【原文：The European Central Bank likely has room to continue lowering borrowing costs as inflation converges toward 2%, but must proceed carefully, Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel told Finanztip.】

item.title: 富士电视台在主持人行为调查中失去更多广告客户
item.description: 日本广播公司富士电视台被指控有不当行为，其处理方式也受到质疑，因此失去了更多的广告客户，丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp.）也加入了停止该频道广告的行列。【原文：Japanese broadcaster Fuji TV lost more advertisers following allegations about inappropriate behavior by a celebrity host and questions about its handling of the case, with Toyota Motor Corp. joining those halting commercials on the channel.】

item.title: 英国市场动荡推升抵押贷款成本至五个月新高
item.description: 英国最受欢迎的抵押贷款成本已升至 8 月份以来的最高水平，因为政府债务市场的动荡已传导至购房者的借贷成本。【原文：The cost of the UK’s most popular mortgages have risen to their highest level since August as the turbulence that’s gripped the government debt market feeds through into the cost of borrowing for home buyers.】

item.title: 禁令生效，苹果和谷歌将 TikTok 从美国应用商店下架
item.description: 苹果公司和谷歌按照周日生效的一项法律的要求，将 TikTok 从其在美国的移动应用商店中下架，此前该社交媒体公司的法律挑战未能阻止去年为解决国家安全问题而通过的措施。【原文：Apple Inc. and Google removed TikTok from their mobile app stores in the US as required by a law that took effect Sunday, after the social media company’s legal challenges failed to head off the measure passed last year to address national security concerns.】

item.title: 特朗普回国前，伊朗大停电使工业陷入困境
item.description:
由于电网在制裁和投资缩减的影响下陷入困境，制造商经常陷入困境。未来四年可能会更加艰难。【原文：

Manufacturers routinely go dark as the grid buckles under sanctions and shrinking investment. The next four years may be harder.

】

item.title: 西澳大利亚皮尔巴拉地区港口在气旋警告下关闭
item.description: 由于热带气旋 "肖恩 "开始在西澳大利亚铁矿石丰富的地区沿海形成，皮尔巴拉港务局在周六晚些时候关闭了丹皮尔港、阿什伯顿港、瓦兰努斯岛港和普雷斯顿西角港。【原文：Pilbara Ports Authority closed the Ports of Dampier, Ashburton, Varanus Island, and Cape Preston West late Saturday as Tropical Cyclone Sean began forming off the coast of Western Australia’s iron ore-rich region.】

item.title: 威利斯将在新西兰经济增长部改组中担任领导职务
item.description: 新西兰总理克里斯托弗-卢克森（Christopher Luxon）表示，作为旨在促进2025年经济发展的内阁改组的一部分，新西兰财政部长尼古拉-威利斯（Nicola Willis）将兼任经济增长部长一职。【原文：New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis will take on the additional role of Minister for Economic Growth as part of a cabinet reshuffle aimed at boosting the economy in 2025, Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said.】
